instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LP8545: What is LP8545? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.LP8548: What is LP8548? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Liquid spill? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high? Check backlight chip area for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
After a look to the board I saw no liquid corosion traces. 
What do you mean with <SIGNAL>SMC_LED</SIGNAL> high?
which IC is the backlight chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
Duke said LID, not led.
Backlight chip is <CHIP>LP8545</CHIP>
Check schematic and see which chip creates Vled out for screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>
<CHIP>LP8548</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>? Inspect for corrosion around <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3V44. and I don't see any corrosion arround the <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Got another LCD assembly to test?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
I ve just tested the pin1 of the LVDS connector. it got no <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>.
then <DIODE>D7710</DIODE>: Anode has 12V7 but cathode zero. feedback is missing. what can it be?
maybe short <RESISTOR>R7732</RESISTOR>? will test in a minute.
No voltage devider is ok.
<TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> gate is low 1V7. need to be more then 7V. pin1/2/3 are zero, and pin5 is 12V. will this mean the the <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> is dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: This can only happen when <DIODE>D7710</DIODE> is dead/open. I have never seen this happen, test <DIODE>D7710</DIODE> on diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Already done. seems to be normal. in diode mode test gives 0V3 forward. and in sper it gives zero.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Then there must be voltage on both sides.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
Are you measuring this with LCD plugged in? <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> is switching so nothing interesting to measure there.

You must verify this board with another LCD assembly to be sure it is ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
Yes indeed. i was measuring with lcd plugged in. if measuring without LCd voltage must be there?
will test after 2 hours from now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Without LCD voltages will NOT be there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Right. just tested and voltage was not there. Is another working display manatory or is there another methode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Get a test assembly, a cracked one or something. Where are you located?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message:
I m in The Netherlands.
And indeed I ve borrowed an LCD from a working mac. And indeed image showed up. thanks.
But there should be a way; a signal coming at the LVDS connector or from the LCD to the SMC for example that can confirm this problem, I presume.

Now the we know that the problem is the LCD. can we fix this issue if we disassemnle the LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Buy a complete assembly! Make sure to order for the correct model year.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: Okai. But how can you confirm that the LCD is dead by measuring signals on the LCD connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a chime with grey onscure beeld
threads.message: You can't. Simple substitution confirmed already that your LCD is bad. You could try and swap the LCD cable, but anything past that is not worth the effort in my eyes and the assembly should be replaced.
